item.title: 土耳其人民银行股价暴跌，因美国案件休庭
item.description: 土耳其国有银行Halk Bankasi AS的股价周三早盘一度下跌7%，此前美国法院就该行涉嫌规避伊朗制裁的指控召开的庭前会议宣布休庭。【原文：Shares of the Turkish state lender Halk Bankasi AS fell as much as 7% on Wednesday morning following the adjournment of a court status conference in the US related to charges of evading sanctions on Iran.】

item.title: SK海力士利润激增，得益于对人工智能内存的持续需求
item.description: SK海力士公司公布了创纪录的季度业绩，凸显了人工智能浪潮的深度——这场浪潮引发了前所未有的存储器需求激增。【原文：SK Hynix Inc. reported its strongest quarterly results to date, underscoring the depth of an artificial intelligence wave that’s triggered an unprecedented surge in memory demand.】

item.title: ASML计划在荷兰和美国裁员约1700人，尽管销售额激增
item.description: ASML控股公司首席执行官克里斯托夫·福凯在声明中表示，该公司计划裁减约1700个岗位，主要涉及技术部门和IT组织。就在同一天，这家荷兰半导体设备制造商宣布其销售额连续第13年实现增长。【原文：ASML Holding NV plans about 1,700 job cuts mainly in its Technology and the IT organizations, Chief Executive Officer Christophe Fouquet said in a statement on the same day the Dutch semiconductor equipment maker reported its 13th consecutive year of sales growth.】

item.title: 日本电产承诺改革，会计调查将于下月结束
item.description: 日本电产公司承诺将彻底改革其不惜一切代价追求增长的企业文化，并修复内部控制体系中的漏洞。该公司正努力摆脱会计丑闻的影响——该丑闻已导致其债务评级被降至垃圾级，并面临退市风险。【原文：Nidec Corp. pledged to overhaul a growth-at-all-costs culture and fix weaknesses in internal controls as the company seeks to overcome an accounting scandal that’s seen its debt rating cut to junk and put it at risk of delisting.】

item.title: 越南与欧盟即将宣布建立全面战略伙伴关系
item.description: 越南与欧盟预计将宣布建立全面战略伙伴关系，欧洲理事会主席安东尼奥·科斯塔将于周四开始对这个东南亚国家进行正式访问。【原文：Vietnam and the European Union are expected to announce a comprehensive strategic partnership as European Council President Antonio Costa begins his official visit to the Southeast Asian nation on Thursday.】

item.title: 法国央行行长莱斯库尔表示，日元汇率波动时应让市场发挥作用
item.description: 法国财政部长罗兰·莱斯库尔在主持七国集团财长会议后，对日元汇率的波动不以为意。【原文：French Finance Minister Roland Lescure shrugged off gyrations in the yen after chairing a meeting of his Group of Seven counterparts.】

item.title: 日元飙升之际，日本散户投资者逆势押注日元
item.description: 日本散户投资者在日元近期涨势最猛时减持看涨头寸，可能限制其涨幅，因官方干预的传言提振了日元汇率。【原文：Japan’s retail investors unwound bullish bets in the yen during the height of a recent rally, potentially capping its gains as talk of official intervention buoyed the currency.】

item.title: 英镑跌破2021年峰值，富时100指数有望上涨
贝莱德基金趁土耳其股市显现复苏迹象悄然布局
item.description: 土耳其股票已成为贝莱德公司一只表现优异的基金的主要持仓之一。该基金一年前对土耳其市场的配置接近于零，但如今认为该市场正处于可能转折的临界点。【原文：Turkish stocks are among the biggest holdings in a top-performing BlackRock Inc. fund that had near-zero exposure a year ago, but now sees the market on the cusp of a possible turnaround.】

item.title: 卡普空股价创18个月最大涨幅，《生化危机》意外提振市场信心
item.description: 日本电子游戏发行商卡普空公司周三股价创下18个月来最大单日涨幅，此前该公司12月季度财报超出预期。得益于旧作意外强劲的销售表现，市场对该公司业绩将超越预期的乐观情绪得到提振。【原文：Japanese video game publisher Capcom Co. posted its biggest single-day share gain in 18 months on Wednesday after December-quarter earnings beat expectations, helped by unexpectedly strong sales of older titles that bolstered optimism the company will surpass forecasts.】

item.title: ASML创纪录订单量远超预期，人工智能推动需求激增
item.description: ASML控股公司第四季度订单量超出分析师预期，人工智能基础设施的快速发展推动了对该公司尖端芯片制造设备的需求。【原文：ASML Holding NV’s orders in the fourth quarter exceeded analysts’ expectations, as the rapid development of artificial intelligence infrastructure boosted demand for its cutting-edge chip-making machines.】

item.title: 穆迪将肯尼亚评级上调至B3，展望调整为稳定
item.description: 穆迪评级机构上调了对肯尼亚债务的评估，理由是短期内违约风险降低。【原文：Moody’s Ratings upgraded its assessment of Kenya’s debt, citing a reduced risk of default in the near-term.】

item.title: 林吉特受特朗普言论及央行表态提振，升至2018年高点
item.description: 在美元普遍走弱以及马来西亚央行可能对本币汇率水平持宽容态度的迹象下，马来西亚林吉特升至近八年来的最高水平。【原文：The Malaysian ringgit rose to its strongest in nearly eight years amid broad dollar weakness and signs the central bank may be comfortable with the currency’s level.】

item.title: 台湾将四家国有资产管理公司合并为市值120亿美元的企业
item.description: 台湾计划将四家国有资产管理公司合并为一家本地基金巨头，管理资产规模约达120亿美元。此举旨在推动岛内金融业整合，以提升其竞争力。【原文：Taiwan plans to merge its four state-backed asset managers into a local fund giant with about $12 billion of assets, as the government seeks consolidation in the island’s financial industry to boost its competitiveness.】

item.title: 欧洲央行副行长西波隆称不确定性可能加剧，拖累经济复苏
item.description: 据《国家报》采访报道，欧洲央行执行委员会成员皮耶罗·奇波隆尼警告称，全球动荡可能冲击欧元区。【原文：European Central Bank Executive Board member Piero Cipollone warned that global turbulence could hit the euro area, according to an interview in El Pais.】

item.title: SK创新称与福特终止电池合作致其损失26亿美元
item.description: SK创新公司表示，终止与福特汽车公司在美国的电池合资企业导致3.7万亿韩元（26亿美元）的资产损失，全球电动汽车野心收缩的代价正波及整个供应链。【原文：SK Innovation Co. said the termination of a battery joint venture with Ford Motor Co. in the US resulted in a 3.7 trillion won ($2.6 billion) asset loss, as the cost of a pullback in global electric vehicle ambitions ripples through the supply chain.】

item.title: Revolut在墨西哥推出15%储蓄利率，与银行展开竞争
item.description: Revolut有限公司周二在墨西哥启动银行业务，推出15%的存款利率，试图抢占该国陷入困境的市场份额。【原文：Revolut Ltd. launched banking operations in Mexico on Tuesday, offering a 15% interest rate on deposits as it seeks to grab a chunk of the country’s embattled market.】

item.title: 数字边缘将在印尼建造价值45亿美元的数据中心园区
item.description: 亚洲数字基础设施公司Digital Edge计划投资45亿美元，在印尼建设该国规模最大的数据中心园区之一。该公司由另类资产管理公司Stonepeak Partners支持。【原文：Digital Edge, an Asian digital infrastructure firm backed by alternative asset manager Stonepeak Partners, plans to invest $4.5 billion to build one of Indonesia’s largest data center campuses.】

item.title: 瞧瞧那些溜溜球拿你的钱换点不值钱的东西
item.description:
像特朗普那样猛砸美元显然会造成伤害。但中国的黄金狂购同样如此。

【原文：

Banging down the dollar like Trump is obviously hurts. But so does China’s gold binge.

】

item.title: 韩国将允许杠杆型单只股票ETF上市以吸引散户资金
item.description: 韩国监管机构计划批准高风险单一股票交易所交易基金，此举将支持该国证券交易所推进产品多元化，并允许散户投资者进行更多杠杆操作。【原文：South Korean regulators plan to approve high‑risk single‑stock exchange‑traded funds, supporting the bourse’s push to diversify products and allowing retail investors more leveraged bets.】

item.title: 非洲利率决议即将启动，预计降息幅度有限，多数央行将按兵不动
item.description: 非洲主要经济体——包括埃及、尼日利亚和肯尼亚——正准备在今年首次政策会议上降息，因价格压力持续减弱。不过随着宽松周期临近尾声，央行决策者预计将谨慎行事。【原文：Key African economies — including Egypt, Nigeria and Kenya — are poised to cut interest rates at their first policy meetings of the year as price pressures continue to slow, though central bankers are expected to tread carefully as easing cycles near their end.】

item.title: 中国正就达尔文港问题"密切关注"澳大利亚
item.description: 中国驻澳大利亚大使表示，北京正"密切关注"堪培拉如何处理目前租给中国企业的港口问题——工党政府曾承诺将该港口收回本土控制。中方必要时将介入此事。【原文：Beijing is “watching very closely” how Canberra handles the status of a port currently leased to a Chinese firm that the Labor government has pledged to return to local control, and will step in if necessary, China’s envoy to Australia said.】

item.title: 高盛警告金属涨势面临风险，因用户"反应消极"
item.description: 高盛集团表示，今年基本金属的涨势将面临逆风，因飙升的价格和看涨情绪与制造商需求疲软的现实相冲突，尤其在中国市场。【原文：Base metals’ rally this year will face headwinds as soaring prices and bullish sentiment clash with the reality of softer demand from manufacturers, especially in China, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 丹格特任命MTN首席执行官加入化肥子公司董事会，公司计划进行首次公开募股
item.description: 非洲首富拥有的丹格特工业公司任命MTN集团首席执行官拉尔夫·穆皮塔加入其化肥业务董事会，该公司正筹备在尼日利亚扩大该业务并实现上市。【原文：Dangote Industries, owned by Africa’s richest man, appointed MTN Group Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Ralph Mupita to the board of its fertilizer business as it prepares to expand and list the operation in Nigeria.】

item.title: 日本40年期国债发售平息市场恐慌，此前市场曾出现崩盘
item.description: 日本国债价格上涨，此前40年期国债拍卖获得自3月以来最强劲的需求，缓解了市场对长期债务的即时担忧，尽管在临时选举前财政问题日益严峻。【原文：Japanese bonds gained after a 40-year auction drew the strongest demand since March, easing immediate worries about long-term debt even as fiscal concerns mount ahead of a snap election.】

item.title: 亚马逊误发裁员邮件，员工担忧大规模裁员
item.description: 亚马逊公司员工们原本就对可能数以千计的裁员心怀忐忑，周二深夜又添新忧：一位高管的会议邀请函和邮件被提前泄露。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. employees who have been anticipating layoffs numbering in the thousands got one more thing to worry about late Tuesday: a meeting invite and email from a top executive that was sent prematurely.】

item.title: 中国电动卡车热潮对液化天然气需求构成新威胁
item.description: 中国电动卡车的快速普及——去年其销量首次超越燃油卡车——正威胁着该国化石燃料供应商的关键需求来源。【原文：China’s rapid adoption of electric trucks — which overtook gas-powered vehicle sales for the first time last year — is threatening a key source of demand for the country’s suppliers of the fossil fuel.】

item.title: 铝价触及2022年高点，特朗普对美元疲软持宽容态度
item.description: 铝价升至近四年高点——其他基本金属也出现反弹——此前美国总统唐纳德·特朗普似乎对美元大幅下跌不以为意。【原文：Aluminum rose to the highest level in almost four years — and other base metals rallied — after US President Donald Trump appeared unperturbed by a steep decline in the dollar.】

item.title: 随着核能发展计划推进，印度或将订购更多国产反应堆
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度计划订购第三批本土设计的核反应堆，作为一项雄心勃勃的努力的一部分，旨在以可控成本扩大核电产能。【原文：India is set to order a third fleet of locally designed reactors as part of an ambitious effort to expand nuclear power capacity at a manageable cost, according to people familiar with the plan.】

item.title: 香港房价在2025年迎来自2021年以来首次上涨
item.description: 香港住宅价格录得四年来的首次年度涨幅，这是该市住宅市场开始从长期低迷中复苏的最明确信号。【原文：Hong Kong home prices recorded their first annual increase in four years, the clearest sign yet that the city’s residential market is beginning to recover from a prolonged downturn.】
